title: Emergency Documentation-First Enforcement Framework
context: Critical process failure where agents implemented MCP servers without consulting official documentation
problem: System-wide architectural crisis due to assumption-based development without documentation validation

solution.approach: Emergency deployment of mandatory documentation-first requirements across all RIF agents
components: Updated all 7 core RIF agents with mandatory documentation consultation requirements
Created comprehensive documentation validator with blocking mechanisms
Integrated emergency protocols into CLAUDE.md with mandatory enforcement
Implemented 100% test coverage for documentation requirements
Added blocking mechanisms that prevent assumption-based development

impact.system: Restored architectural integrity across entire RIF framework
impact.user_trust: Eliminated frustration from repeated implementation failures
impact.process: Established documentation-first as core RIF principle

lessons_learned: Documentation consultation must be MANDATORY before any implementation
Agent instructions need explicit documentation requirements with enforcement
Emergency protocols can successfully address system-critical failures in hours
Comprehensive testing validates emergency implementations effectively
Blocking mechanisms prevent process violations more effectively than guidance
reusable_components: DocumentationValidator class for blocking non-compliant work
Documentation evidence template for standardized validation
Emergency protocol framework for critical process corrections
Comprehensive test suite pattern for validation frameworks
prevention_measures: All agent instructions now require documentation consultation FIRST
Pre-implementation validation gates block work without documentation evidence
Knowledge base integration with official documentation sources
Real-time monitoring for assumption-based development attempts
